text:
Q: What's the best way to get a live update of a laptops battery percentage and status via a C program? A:

like battery percent changes and when it gets plugged in and out. The program is for my touchbar on my mac (see Asahi Linux for linux on M series macs) and I want to put the battery percentage and time on it as well as a bunch of other things. Most of them are working but I'm stuck on the battery. Also the documentation is really technical and i dont want to sift through so much code so I came here to try and find the best solution.

Q: What are your favorite C++ STL alternatives? A:

In C++ the STL refers only to the containers and algorithms part of the Standard Library. The term for the standard library that comes with C++ is simply referred to as the Standard Library, of which the STL is just a small part.

Q: Cloudflare API return 403 "Enable JavaScript and cookies to continue" A:

I tested with several HTTP C++ components in Rad Studio (include external CURL). Same header on the API request simulating POSTMAN, only CHILKAT returned 200 and the correct response. The others 403. Same header logged and yet different responses.

Q: Is it possible to connect the New Outlook for Windows to our own server? A:

Thanks a @Dmitry.

I understood your point. What is still unclear to me is, I want to create something that connects to my mail server, fetches all mailboxes and displays data on outlook.

The similar thing that we could achieve using Extended MAPI.

I use OutlookSpy and it is doing the same thing. It can open a profile. It can open a mail box. Can real all mails and can read Outlook properties and write to it so that Outlook displays it.

Can we achieve something like that?

Q: issue with determining year difference using ChronoUnit in Java A:

This result occurs because ChronoUnit counts complete units, not elapsed time converted into years or months.

In your example, a full year has not passed:
2023-11-13 → 2024-11-12 is one day short of a complete year, so ChronoUnit.YEARS.between correctly returns 0.

If the end date were 2024-11-13, a full year would have passed and the result would be 1.

The same applies to months: since a full 12 months have not passed, ChronoUnit.MONTHS.between returns 11.

Q: Python pip raising NewConnectionError while installing libraries A:

In my case none of the solutions here worked because the issue was a misconfiguration. I had a custom python repository set up in pip.conf, and the host name changed (my-server.home) so pip couldn't fetch repository data:

~/.pip/pip.conf:

[global]
    trusted-host = my-server.home
    extra-index-url = http://my-server.home/simple

In your case, pip config file could be global, e.g. under /etc/pip.conf.

Otherwise run pip -vvv install [pacakage] and it will tell you which repositories it is unable to reach (the output is quite verbose).
